title: 111_hr3282
content: The program provides readjustment and mental health care services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a program to provide peer outreach, support, readjustment counseling, and mental health services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as their immediate family members. The program provides readjustment counseling, mental health services, and support to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as their immediate family members for three years post-deployment. The program offers counseling, mental health services, and support to veterans and their families for readjustment to civilian life, recovery from injuries, and post-deployment readjustment. The Secretary will contract with community mental health centers and qualified entities for service provision. The Secretary will contract with community mental health centers and qualified entities to provide services for veterans in areas not adequately served by VA health care facilities. Contracts require employing veterans trained under subsection (c) and using telehealth services. The Department of Veterans Affairs contracts with community health centers to provide services for veterans, requiring them to employ veterans, use telehealth services, participate in training programs, and comply with VA protocols. The Department of Veterans Affairs requires community health centers to comply with VA protocols, submit annual reports on veterans served, diagnosed, and treatment provided. The Department of Veterans Affairs mandates community health centers to submit annual reports on veterans served, diagnosed, and treatment provided, including demographic information and clinical summaries for each veteran receiving mental health services. The Department of Veterans Affairs requires community health centers to provide clinical summary information for veterans receiving mental health services. Additionally, the Secretary must contract with a national mental health organization to train veterans for peer-outreach and peer-support services. The Secretary will contract with a national mental health organization to train veterans for peer-outreach and peer-support services, as well as conduct a training program for clinicians to provide required mental health services. The Secretary will contract with mental health centers or entities to ensure clinicians can provide services for veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom using best practices and technologies. Reports on the plan for implementation are required within 45 days of the enactment of this Act. The Secretary will submit reports on the plan for implementing the program within 45 days of the enactment of this Act. The Secretary will submit a report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs on the implementation of the program, including information on the number of veterans who received services and the type of services received in the last calendar year. The report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs will include information on the number of veterans receiving services, the type of services, an evaluation of service provision, and a recommendation on extending the service period. The report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs will include an evaluation of service provision by national mental health organizations, training assessment, and a recommendation on extending the service period to five years.
